page.title: 04Fairoak Pit, Cannock Chase
page.content: Rapidly becoming overgrown by the forest lies the site of Fair Oak Colliery. Beneath the undergrowth can be found the top of the shafts as well as the remains of the circular powder house which stood beside the Stonybrook Pool that provided water for the pit. A company was formed in 1871 which sank two shafts. Number one shaft was abandoned in 1875 without finding workable seams. In April 1876 coal was found at number two shaft but underground flooding and the depression in coal mining led to its closure in the 1880Â£s. The routes of the old tramway and railway that served the colliery now serve as paths for walkers on the Chase.
